More specifically, a qualifying cash flow hedge should be accounted for as follows: Time value

An entity’s defined risk management strategy for a particular hedging relationship may exclude a specific component of the gain or loss, or related cash flows, on the hedging derivative from the assessment of hedge effectiveness (as discussed in paragraphs 81–83B of FASB ASC 815-20-25). That excluded component of the gain or loss should be recognized in earnings either through an amortization approach in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-25-83A or through a mark-to-market approach in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-25-83B. Under either approach, the amount recognized in earnings for an excluded component should be presented in the same income statement line item as the earnings effect of the hedged item in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-45-1A. For example, if the effectiveness of a hedging relationship with an option is assessed based on changes in the option’s intrinsic value, the changes in the option’s time value would be excluded from the assessment of hedge effectiveness and either may be recognized in earnings through an amortization approach in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-25-83A or currently in earnings in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-25-83B. a.

Amounts in accumulated other comprehensive income related to the derivative designated as a hedging instrument included in the assessment of hedge effectiveness are reclassified to earnings in the same period or periods during which the hedged forecasted transaction affects earnings in accordance with paragraphs 38–41 of 815-30-35 and presented in the same income statement line item as the earnings effect of the hedged item in accordance with FASB ASC 815-20-45-1A. The balance in accumulated other comprehensive income associated with the hedged transaction should be the cumulative gain or loss on the derivative instrument from inception of the hedge less all of the following items: () the derivative instrument’s gains or losses previously reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income into earnings pursuant to paragraphs 38–41 of FASB ASC 815-30-35; () the cumulative amount amortized to earnings related to excluded components accounted for through an amortization approach in accordance with paragraph FASB ASC 815-20-25-83A; and () the cumulative change in fair value of an excluded component for which changes in fair value are recorded currently in earnings in accordance with paragraph 815-20-25-83B. b. a b c
